title: Wine Key
description: We developed this application at the request of Fire&Vine, a company best known for their El Gaucho locations across the greater Seattle area. With this app, a user can view wine inventories for stores across the company and locate excess bottles that may not be sold otherwise. Management can update their store inventory at the click of a button, and quickly contact locations they KNOW have the wine they need without having to call around.

title: Wavel
description: Wavel - where your travel inquiries meet weather forecasts, best restaurants to try, and hotel availabilities in a single search. This was my first team project in UW's Bootcamp. With Wavel, a user can search for a city by name, and a series of web APIs gather information to return a five-day forecast, top-rated restaurants, and available hotels in that city, as well as an interactive map of the area.

title: Burger Builders!
description: Burger Builders is a fun little page where a user can enter a description of a hamburger they'd like to eat. Their burger can be moved back and forth between a ready-to-eat column and a consumed column, or deleted from the page. This project utilizes a mySQL database to persistently store user's burger information.

title: Note Taker
description: This application allows a user to create persistent notes that can be saved, viewed, and deleted. It was my first assignment deployed using heroku.

title: Random Password Generator
description: This little project was among my first assignments. It allows a user to set preferences regarding a length and what types of characters they'd like in their password and generates a a string randomly that meets their requirements.

title: Day Planner
description: This is a simple calendar app for scheduling your workday. It saves a user's created schedule to local storage so they may reference it again.
